- Avery RL, Bakri SJ, Blumenkranz MS, Brucker AJ, Cunningham ETJ, D'Amico DJ, et al. Intravitreal injection technique and monitoring: Updated guidelines of an expert panel. Retina (Philadelphia, Pa) 2014; 34:S1-S18. - Dossarps D, Bron AM, Koehrer P, Aho-Glélé LS, Creuzot-Garcher C, net F, et al. Endophthalmitis After Intravitreal Injections: Incidence, Presentation, Management, and Visual Outcome. American journal of ophthalmology 2015; 160(1):17-250. - Fagan XJ, Al-Qureshi S. Intravitreal injections: a review of the evidence for best practice. Clinical & experimental ophthalmology 2013; 41(5):500-7. - Nentwich MM, Yactayo-Miranda Y, Schwarzbach F, Wolf A, Kampik A, Mino de Kaspar H. Endophthalmitis after intravitreal injection: decreasing incidence and clinical outcome-8-year results from a tertiary ophthalmic referral center. Retina (Philadelphia, Pa) 2014; 34(5):943-50. - Website of the OpenEyes project: http://www.openeyes.org.uk/

details.use: Either to provide details about the procedure whenever a intravitreal injection is scheduled, or to register the consequent realization of that procedure.

items.items: Allocation where the intravitreal injection takes place.
Details concerning the anaesthetic prior to the procedure.
Route chosen to apply the anesthesia.
Details about preparation of the intervention.
Anti-infective agent used for skin cleanse.
Pre Injection IOP Lowering Therapy Required
Select if pre Injection IOP lowering therapy is required.
Therapy chosen to lower patient's IOP prior to injections.
Compound contained within the intravitreal injection.
Batch number of the injections used.
Expiry date for the batch of injections used.
Number of injections involved in the current intervention.
Details about procedures after intravitreal injections to guarantee patient's safety.
Post Injection IOP Lowering Therapy Required
Select if IOP lowering is required after injection.
Therapy chosen to lower patient's IOP after injections.
Possible complications due to intravitreal injections.
Routine examination to check the patient's status after the therapy.
Evaluation about if the patient is able to count fingers or not.
Intraocular pressure measurement is recommended or not.
Apraclonidine (trade name Iopidine Eye) 0.5% intra-ocular solution.
Apraclonidine (trade name Iopidine Eye) 1% intra-ocular solution.
Apraclonidine (trade name Iopidine Eye) 0.5% intra-ocular solution.
Apraclonidine (trade name Iopidine Eye) 1% intra-ocular solution.
Details about a preventive treatment of antibiotics after intravitreal injections.
Other complication not provided in the list.
Use or not of a sterile drape before injection.
Use of speculum or on the contrary manual eye lid retraction, to prevent contact of the eyelashes and eyelid margins with both the injection site and the injection needle.
Use of surgical masks by clinicians and patients, or on the contrary, do not use mask but minimize speaking to reduce infection risk during procedure.
Use of sterile or nonsterile gloves during the intervention.
Distance in mm of the needle posterior to the limbus between the vertical and horizontal rectus muscles.
Identifies possible contraindications (if any) to be considered before conducting ITV injections.
Active external infection, including active infection in blepharitis.
Eyelid, adnexal, and ocular surface abnormalities.
Intravitreal injections performed in ophthalmologist's office.
Intravitreal injections performed in a dedicated treatment room.
Intravitreal injections performed in the operating room.
Eyes treated in the same sitting.
IVT injection on the left eye.
IVT injection on the right eye.
Application or not of anti-infective agent to the eyelids, including the eyelid margins and eyelashes.
Need or not of pupillary dilation prior to the surgical intervention.
Attach a list that restricts the anesthetic agents, to those compounds used in ophthalmology to anaesthetize patients prior to intravitreal injection.
List of anti-infective agents available for opthalmic use.
List of anti-infective agents available for opthalmic use.
List of compounds validated for intraocular injection
Compounds administered in ophthalmology in the form of intraocular injection.
